com.andresjesse.jpctblend

Interface IActor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SampleActor

    public interface IActor
    Actor Interface, this is the Skeleton of each Actor loaded in a JPCTBlend Scene. You must implement this if you want to add a custom Actor in your scene.
    Author:
    andres

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      Create here your behavior, 'act' is called at each frame, so you don't need to create a loop here.
      void addToWorld(com.threed.jpct.World world)
      Create here your logic to add your actor to the world.
      void removeFromWorld()
      Create here your logic to remove actor from world.
      void setPosition(com.threed.jpct.SimpleVector pos)
      Set position to your actor (make sure to configure all objects if you have more than one).
      void setRotation(com.threed.jpct.SimpleVector pos)
      Set rotation to your actor (make sure to configure all objects if you have more than one).

    • Method Detail

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(com.threed.jpct.SimpleVector pos)
        Set position to your actor (make sure to configure all objects if you have more than one). This method is called by JPCTBlend when loading scene
        Parameters:
        pos - Actor position

      • setRotation

        void setRotation(com.threed.jpct.SimpleVector pos)
        Set rotation to your actor (make sure to configure all objects if you have more than one). This method is called by JPCTBlend when loading scene
        Parameters:
        pos - Actor position

      • addToWorld

        void addToWorld(com.threed.jpct.World world)
        Create here your logic to add your actor to the world.
        Parameters:
        world - World to add the actor

      • removeFromWorld

        void removeFromWorld()
        Create here your logic to remove actor from world.

      • act

        void act()
        Create here your behavior, 'act' is called at each frame, so you don't need to create a loop here. More info in the JPCTBlend Manual.
